comments:
Here's what I did:
1. Set up a Tomcat 5.0 server with jdk 1.4.2
2. Create a Web module (targetted to Tomcat 5.0)and add a simple bean to it 
(Echo)
3. Select the bean and launch the Web service wizard.
Page 1: Next
Page 2: Next
Page 3: Click Edit and select the Tomcat 5.0 Server. Click OK. Click Next.
Page 4: Next.

The wizard hangs after a few seconds. Below is the console output. In the trace 
you can see that a command called "RefreshProjectCommand" gets executed. Line 
49 of this command does a project refresh like this:

project.refreshLocal(IProject.DEPTH_INFINITE, new NullProgressMonitor());

I CTRL-Breaked and will try to attach the Java dump. I can't reproduce this but 
I'll add more information if I can reproduce it consistently.

- Moving this to wst.wsdl since it looks like Kathy's stack trace has nothing 
related to J2EE tools in it. 
- Adding Chuck on the CC list. 
- Increasing severity to critical since two of us have seen it now.

The wizard hangs while executing the RefreshProjectCommand right after a WSDL 
is generated from the JavaBean.

The line "project.refreshLocal(IProject.DEPTH_INFINITE,...)" is causing the 
hang for an unknown reason at the moment.

Modifying it to "project.refreshLocal(IProject.DEPTH_ONE,...)" gets it out of 
the endless loop.

Once I pass this I see the error dialog popup:
    "Error occurred when adding the module, foo, to the server."
which may or may not be the real error that has been hiding.

- Kihup

Rupam,
As discussed. It looks to be a refresh problem.
- Kihup

Instead of calling refreshLocal with IProject.DEPTH_INFINITE, Kihup has 
suggested trying to target the refresh to specific folders. Using 
IProject.DEPTH_ONE will likely not work because Axis is generating artifacts 
into folders at a greater depth. 

Kihup seemes to be the only one who can reproduce this problem so we can try 
any proposed fixes in his environment. 

Changing component to jst.ws

To repro this, start by creating a fresh project.  It doesn't seem to happen, 
or at least not reliably, with an existing project.

This is consistent with the idea that a new resource is being created that, 
upon RefreshProject, triggers the hang (e.g., keeps refreshing).

Note: during the hang, CPU is 100%; and we don't blow out the stack.  This is a 
loop, not a deadlock or endless recursion.

I wonder what the new resource is, that is causing the RefreshProject to blow 
up?

Even when I create a new project and new component, I can't reproduce this. 
Kihup can't reproduce it either on the 20050428 integration build. Not knowing 
what caused the problem or what made it go away is a tad disconcerting but I'm 
closing this defect. We can reopen if the problem appears again.
We can reopen if the problem appears again.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
